titles.title: Supply Chain Improvement Act
Supply Chain Improvement Act
Supply Chain Improvement Act

To direct the Secretary of Transportation to give priority consideration for certain Department of Transportation grant programs to eligible projects that improve or build resiliency in the supply chain, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials Discharged.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 635.

committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure
committee.activity: Reported By, Markup By, Discharged, Discharged, Discharged, Referred To

bill.summary:
Supply Chain Improvement Act
This bill directs the Department of Transportation to prioritize providing grants under certain programs for projects that improve or build resiliency in the supply chain, including multimodal projects. These programs include the Infrastructure for Rebuilding America (INFRA) program, the Mega Program, and the Rebuilding American Infrastructure with Sustainability and Equity (RAISE) program.
